metadata.title: CVE-2017-14505 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
DrawGetStrokeDashArray in wand/drawing-wand.c in ImageMagick 7.0.7-1mishandles certain NULL arrays, which allows attackers to perform Denial ofService (NULL pointer dereference and application crash inAcquireQuantumMemory within MagickCore/memory.c) by providing a craftedImage File as input.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14505` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagick++5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickcore5-extra - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
libmagickwand5 - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
perlmagick - 8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11
No subscription required

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.7.7.10-6ubuntu3.11').
